suggestion: Create unique passwords for your most important accounts.
learnMore: Using the same password for every account puts all of your accounts at risk for attack. To manage many unique passwords, a password manager like 1Password or LastPass can be very helpful!

suggestion: Add a PIN to your phone's SIM card.
learnMore: Hackers can gain access to your SIM card by simply calling your mobile carrier, pretending to be you, and requesting a transfer of your phone number to their device. Protecting your phone's SIM card with a PIN adds an additional layer of security. This can be set up by contacting your mobile carrier.

Most experts recommend setting up two-factor authentication, even with the prevalence of SIM card theft. The most secure two-factor authentication uses a phone number not associated with your physical phone, such as a Google Voice or Skype number.
System updates often include important security updates.
